treatment.description: Leaf blades narrowly lanceolate to narrowly elliptic, 2–5(–8) × 0.3–0.9(–1.5) cm, tomentose to floccose adaxially, not thickened, attenuate to rarely rounded proximally.
treatment.habitat: sandy to gravelly flats and slopes
treatment.discussion: Variety multiflorum is widespread and infrequent to common in scattered and disjunct populations in southern Oklahoma, central and east-central Texas, central Arkansas, and north-central Louisiana.
